xxl.core.io.converters
Class ShortConverter

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.io.converters.Converter<T>
      xxl.core.io.converters.SizeConverter<T>
          xxl.core.io.converters.FixedSizeConverter<java.lang.Short>
              xxl.core.io.converters.ShortConverter
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class ShortConverter
extends FixedSizeConverter<java.lang.Short>

This class provides a converter that is able to read and write Short objects. In addition to the read and write methods that read or write Short objects this class contains readShort and writeShort methods that convert the Short object after reading or before writing it to its primitive short type.

Example uasge (1). 

   // create a byte array output stream
   
   ByteArrayOutputStream output = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
   
   // write a Short and a short value to the output stream
   
   ShortConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE.write(new DataOutputStream(output), (short)42);
   ShortConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE.writeShort(new DataOutputStream(output), (short)4711);
   
   // create a byte array input stream on the output stream
   
   ByteArrayInputStream input = new ByteArrayInputStream(output.toByteArray());
   
   // read a long value and a Long from the input stream
   
   short s1 = ShortConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE.readShort(new DataInputStream(input));
   Short s2 = ShortConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE.read(new DataInputStream(input));
   
   // print the value and the object
   
   System.out.println(s1);
   System.out.println(s2);
   
   // close the streams after use
   
   input.close();
   output.close();

See Also:
DataInput, DataOutput, IOException, Serialized Form

Field Detail

DEFAULT_INSTANCE

public static final ShortConverter DEFAULT_INSTANCE
This instance can be used for getting a default instance of a short converter. It is similar to the Singleton Design Pattern (for further details see Creational Patterns, Prototype in Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software by Erich Gamma, Richard Helm, Ralph Johnson, and John Vlissides) except that there are no mechanisms to avoid the creation of other instances of a short converter.

SIZE

public static final int SIZE
This field contains the number of bytes needed to serialize the short value of a Short object. Because this size is predefined it must not be measured each time.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

Sole constructor. (For invocation by subclass constructors, typically implicit.)

Method Detail

read

public java.lang.Short read(java.io.DataInput dataInput,
                            java.lang.Short object)
                     throws java.io.IOException
Reads the short value for the specified (Short) object from the specified data input and returns the restored object.

This implementation ignores the specified object and returns a new Short object. So it does not matter when the specified object is null.

Specified by:
read in class Converter<java.lang.Short>
Parameters:
dataInput - the stream to read the short value from in order to return a Short object.
object - the (Short) object to be restored. In this implementation it is ignored.
Returns:
the read Short object.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if I/O errors occur.

readShort

public short readShort(java.io.DataInput dataInput)
                throws java.io.IOException
Reads the short value from the specified data input and returns it.

This implementation uses the read method and converts the returned Short object to its primitive short type.

Parameters:
dataInput - the stream to read the short value from.
Returns:
the read short value.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if I/O errors occur.

write

public void write(java.io.DataOutput dataOutput,
                  java.lang.Short object)
           throws java.io.IOException
Writes the short value of the specified Short object to the specified data output.

This implementation calls the writeShort method of the data output with the short value of the object.

Specified by:
write in class Converter<java.lang.Short>
Parameters:
dataOutput - the stream to write the short value of the specified Short object to.
object - the Short object that short value should be written to the data output.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - includes any I/O exceptions that may occur.

writeShort

public void writeShort(java.io.DataOutput dataOutput,
                       short s)
                throws java.io.IOException
Writes the specified short value to the specified data output.

This implementation calls the write method with a Short object wrapping the specified short value.

Parameters:
dataOutput - the stream to write the specified short value to.
s - the short value that should be written to the data output.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - includes any I/O exceptions that may occur.
